qas.question: What did constitutional changes in 2007 prohibit?

answers.text: parties from using religion as a basis for political activity

qas.question: What was the long term goal for Egypt?
What presidential powers were included in 2007 law changes?

answers.text: power to dissolve parliament and end judicial election monitoring

qas.question: What was Dr. Ali El Deen Hilal Dessouki's position?

answers.text: Media Secretary of the National Democratic Party

context: Constitutional changes voted on 19 March 2007 prohibited <a0_0>parties from using religion as a basis for political activity<a0_0/>, allowed the drafting of a new anti-terrorism law, authorised broad police powers of arrest and surveillance, and gave the president <a2_0>power to dissolve parliament and end judicial election monitoring<a2_0/>. In 2009, Dr. Ali El Deen Hilal Dessouki, <a3_0>Media Secretary of the National Democratic Party<a3_0/> (NDP), described Egypt as a "pharaonic" political system, and <a1_0>democracy<a1_0/> as a "long-term goal". Dessouki also stated that "the real center of power in Egypt is the military".
